meanings.definition: Showing too much curiosity about other people's affairs
meanings.sent1: She is the nosiest person in our neighborhood, always asking about everyone's business.
meanings.sent2: My nosiest neighbor always peeks through the curtains to see what's happening outside.
meanings.sent3: The nosiest squirrel in the park kept trying to eavesdrop on the birds' conversations.
meanings.sent4: Her nosiest nature was like a magnifying glass, amplifying every detail of others' lives.
meanings.sent5: The nosiest cat in the house would sit by the window, observing the neighbors with intense interest.

meanings.definition: Having a tendency to snoop or pry into others' business
meanings.sent1: He is the nosiest student in class, always trying to read other people's notes.
meanings.sent2: The nosiest coworker is constantly listening in on private conversations.
meanings.sent3: The nosiest dog in the park kept digging up buried secrets.
meanings.sent4: Her nosiest behavior was like a detective, uncovering hidden information.
meanings.sent5: The nosiest journalist in town never missed a chance to investigate a juicy story.

meanings.definition: Being excessively interested in the affairs of others
meanings.sent1: She is the nosiest aunt, always wanting to know every detail of our lives.
meanings.sent2: The nosiest friend can't resist asking personal questions about everyone.
meanings.sent3: The nosiest parrot in the pet store repeated all the gossip it overheard.
meanings.sent4: His nosiest habit was like a magnet, attracting all the latest news to him.
meanings.sent5: The nosiest neighbor on the block knew more about everyone than they knew about themselves.
